article_title: Blue Cross says it’s making ‘good strides’ to resolve enrollment errors
article_text:
Insurer won't say how many still without policies because of technology glitch

N.C. Attorney General, Insurance Commissioner seek answers, plan reviews

Blue Cross has refunded $1.95M to more than 4,600 over-billed customers

article_metadata.news-keywords: Blue Cross, Blue Shield, ACA, Affordable Care Act, Individual, Health, Insurance, Department, Attorney, General
article_metadata.description: Blue Cross and Blue Shield says it has reinstated health coverage for thousands of stranded customers who were dropped from the insurer’s rolls in a technology debacle that cut off coverage for residents with urgent medical needs and rippled throughout the state.
article_metadata.title: Blue Cross says it’s making ‘good strides’ to resolve enrollment errors | The Charlotte Observer

og.description: Blue Cross and Blue Shield says it has reinstated health coverage for thousands of stranded customers who were dropped from the insurer’s rolls in a technology debacle that cut off coverage for residents with urgent medical needs and rippled throughout the state.
